tool.name: Tool for Linkage Analysis
tool.command:
merlin -p '$pname' -m '$mname' -d '$dname' --quiet --error --best --npl '$markerNames'
#if $minStep --minStep '$minStep' #end if
#if $maxStep --maxStep '$maxStep' #end if
#if $steps --steps '$steps' #end if
#if $grid --grid '$grid' #end if
#if $start --start '$start' #end if
#if $stop --stop '$stop' #end if
#if $randomseed -r '$randomseed' #end if
#if $allelefrequency.allelefreq.value == "maxlike": -fm #elif $allelefrequency.allelefreq.value == "founders": -ff #elif $allelefrequency.allelefreq.value == "individuals": -fa #elif $allelefrequency.allelefreq.value == "equal": -fe #elif $allelefrequency.allelefreq.value == "file": -f '$allelefrequency.file' #end if
> '$merlinoutput'

param.name: pname
param.label: Entering Data File
param.help: Selects input data file, in linkage or QTDT format

param.name: mname
param.label: Entering Map File
param.help: File indicating chromosome and centimorgan position for each marker. Use with QTDT format input files.

param.name: dname
param.label: Entering Pedigree File
param.help: Selects pedigree file, with genotype, phenotype and family structure information

param.name: markerNames
param.label: For Marker Serial Optional Parameter
param.help: Useful to eliminate numbers in positions and introduce serial of MRK Number instead.

param.name: minStep
param.label: For Minimum Step Optional Parameter
param.help: Useful to find the minimum value

param.name: maxStep
param.label: For Maximum Step Optional Paramter
param.help: Useful to find the maximum value

param.name: steps
param.label: n equally spaced locations
param.help: Carry out analyses at n equally spaced locations to analyse between consecutive markers

param.name: grid
param.label: n-cM grid of equally spaced locations
param.help: Carry out analysis along an n-cM grid of equally spaced locations

param.name: randomseed
param.label: Random Sequence
param.help: Selects a different random sequence for simulation and sampling of haplotypes.

param.name: allelefreq
param.label: Source for allele frequency information
param.help: Allele frequencies can be set in one of the four options.

param.name: file
param.label: User Specified file for Allele frequencies

has_text.text: MRK1 MRK2 MRK3 MRK4 MRK5 MRK6 MRK7 MRK8 MRK9 MRK10
A : B C : D E : F G : H

tool.help:
Finding disease genes using high-density single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) maps is a complicated task. By representing patterns of gene flow using sparse binary trees in general pedigrees using only the needed resources and then by deriving pedigree traversals algorithms, the likelihood calculations of the disease genes for the single marker or multi-marker can be carried out efficiently.
`Multipoint Engine for Rapid Likelihood Inference (Merlin) is a computer program that ignores the unlikely possibility of a large number of recombinants on a multipoint calculation. This choice of Merlin increases the speed for pedigree analysis with accurate results. <http://csg.sph.umich.edu/abecasis/merlin/tour/linkage.html>`_
`Merlin performs pedigree analysis by representing the gene flow in pedigrees using a sparse inheritance tree. It also performs rapid haplotyping, genotype error detection, and affected pair linkage analyses and can handle more markers than other pedigree analysis packages. <http://csg.sph.umich.edu/abecasis/merlin/tour/linkage.html>`_
Information: 1. A pedigree is a genetic representation of a family tree that picturizes the inheritance of a trait or disease through several generations. 2. Gene Flow is the transfer of genetic variation from one population to another. 3. Sparse Tree: A two-dimensional matrix with m rows and n columns with most of its elements being zero. 4. Haplotype: It is a combination of alleles or set of single nucleotide polymorphisms on the same chromosome is a set of DNA variations, or polymorphisms, that tend to be inherited together. 5. Genotype Error: It occurs when the observed genotype of an individual does not correspond to the true genotype
